file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-21-03-04 - OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OPTIONAL ATTENDANT SEAT 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the optional flight attendant seat. B. The optional flight attendant seat is installed in the passenger cabin, at zone 262. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH OP- OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - TIONAL ATTENDANT 25-21-03-000-801-A REMOVAL SEAT AIRCRAFT WITH OP- OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - TIONAL ATTENDANT 25-21-03-400-801-A INSTALLATION SEAT AIRCRAFT WITH OP- OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - TIONAL ATTENDANT 25-21-03-040-801-A DEACTIVATION SEAT AIRCRAFT WITH OP- OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - TIONAL ATTENDANT 25-21-03-440-801-A REACTIVATION SEAT EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-21-03 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-21-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OPTIONAL ATTENDANT SEAT 2. OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the optional flight attendant seat. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-004-A (1) Remove the passenger cabin seats at the last right row. (AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the optional flight attendant seat (1) as follows: (a) Remove the bolts (2), washers (3), and spacers (4 and 5) that attach the optional flight attendant seat (1). (b) Lift slowly the optional flight attendant seat (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-21-03 Page 2 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OPTIONAL ATTENDANT SEAT Optional Flight Attendant Seat – Removal/Installation Figure 401 1. OPTIONAL A FLIGHT ZONE ATTENDANT 262 SEAT 2. FLOTATION VEST 3. BOLT 4. WASHER 5. SPACER DET. A 6. SPACER 7. WASHER 8. SPACER 145AMM250360.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-21-03 Page 3 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-21-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OPTIONAL ATTENDANT SEAT 3. OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the optional flight attendant seat. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the optional flight attendant seat assembly (1) as follows: (a) Fit the optional flight attendant seat assembly. (b) Install the optional flight attendant seat assembly with the bolts (2), washers (3) and spacers (4 and 5). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the seats at the last right row (AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-21-03 Page 4 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-21-03-040-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OPTIONAL ATTENDANT SEAT 4. OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - DEACTIVATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to deactivate the optional flight attendant seat. (2) This task refers to item 25-11-04 - Cabin Attendant Seats - of the DDPM (3) The aircraft may be dispatched with the Optional Cabin Attendant Seat inoperative provided: (a) Associated seat position(s) is not occupied; (b) Folding-type seat is stowed or secured in the retracted position; NOTE: • A folding seat that will not stow automatically is considered inoperative. • A seat with a missing or inoperative lap belt and/or shoulder harness is considered inoperative. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit-RH/Cockpit-LH H. Deactivation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Attach an "INOP - DO NOT OCCUPY" placard to the Attendant’s seat and also attach a "FOR FLIGHT ATTENDANT ONLY" placard to the assigned passenger seat. (3) Make an entry in the aircraft technical logbook to show that you did the deactivation procedure for the optional flight attendant seat. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 040-801-A/400 25-21-03 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-21-03-440-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OPTIONAL ATTENDANT SEAT 5. OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - REACTIVATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to reactivate the optional flight attendant. (2) This task refers to item 25-11-04 - Cabin Attendant Seats - of the DDPM B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - INSPEC- AMM TASK 25-21-03-200-801-A/600 TION C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit-RH/Cockpit-LH I. Reactivation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Do the troubleshooting and the applicable corrective maintenance procedure for the optional flight attendant seats AMM TASK 25-21-03-200-801-A/600. (3) Make an entry in the aircraft technical logbook to show that you did the reactivation procedure for the flight attendant seat. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 440-801-A/400 25-21-03 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
